DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to represent a Lauren Classification histologic categorization of gastric carcinoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant epithelial tumor of the stomach mucosa. The vast majority of gastric carcinomas are adenocarcinomas, arising from the gastric glandular epithelium._The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant epithelial tumor of the stomach mucosa. The vast majority of gastric carcinomas are adenocarcinomas, arising from the gastric glandular epithelium.

Concepts.definition: A malignant epithelial tumor of the stomach mucosa. The vast majority of gastric carcinomas are adenocarcinomas, arising from the gastric glandular epithelium.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A malignant epithelial tumor of the stomach mucosa. ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Intestinal; of, or related to, or referring to the intestines.: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic architectural pattern in which a cellular population is distributed in a relatively uniform fashion throughout a specified tissue area; not focal.: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.
